title.narrative: Support for peacebuilding data UNDP DRC

description.narrative:
Insatsen är ett stöd till UNDP för fortsatt arbete med datainsamling i östra DRK i syfte att tillhandahålla ett unikt rigoröst, kontinuerligt och detaljerat dataset för att stödja programarbete samt uppföljning och utvärdering av framsteg mot fred, rättvisa och säkerhet i DR Kongo. Detta är projektets andra fas, där den första fasen pågick fram till juni 2017.
Verksamheten kommer inledningsvis att fokusera på samma geografiska områden som projektets första fas (Nord- och Sydkivu samt Ituri-provinsen), som fortfarande är mycket utsatta områden trots stora investeringar gjorda av det internationella samfundet. Denna andra fas kommer dock också att göra det möjligt för FN och dess partner att reagera snabbare på tidiga varningar och kan utvidgas till andra delar av landet för att, genom tillförlitliga data och analyser, stödja åtgärder för att förebygga potentiella konflikter och eskaleringar av våld som liknar de som nyligen sett i Kasai och Tanganyika.

The contribution is a support to UNDP for continued work on data collection in eastern DRC in order to provide a unique, rigorous, continuous and detailed dataset to support program work as well as follow-up and evaluation of progress towards peace, justice and security in DR Congo. This is the second phase of the project, where the first phase ends in June 2017.
Polling will focus on the same geographic areas as the first phase of the project (North and South Kivu and Ituri Province), which are still highly exposed areas despite major investments made by the international community. However, this second phase will also allow the UN and its partners to respond faster to early warning and expand to other parts of the country to support, through reliable data and analysis, measures to prevent potential conflicts and escalations of violence such as similar to those recently seen in Kasai and Tanganyika.

The objective of the project is to: Contribute to sustainability of peace in the DRC and strengthen peace-building and reconstruction efforts undertaken by the Government and its partners, including the United Nations system, through the collection of accurate and reliable data in order to contribute to better formulation of policies and programs on security, justice and stabilization.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The project has reported good results as the quarterly polls have been conducted and reported according to plan. A total of 7 polls were planned during the project period, and to date five reports have been released with polling for the sixth already finalized. Polling for the 7th survey is scheduled for June/july 2019. During the project period we have also seen the national statistic institute take on more initiative and have released two qualitative reports. Although quality and layout are not the best, it still shows that they are involved in the process. However, doubt they are yet able to lead on the full quantitative research. Parts of the funds have gone to allow for surveys in ISSSS PZ. This has been very useful and has allowed for us as a donor also to the SCF to get in-depth data on the security situation in eastern DRC. Communication with UNDP has worked well. Embassy has also on occasions been in touch with HHI and have met them in meetings in Kinshasa.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
